info.title: Apphub Timestore API
info.description: HTTP API for ingesting, querying, and managing time series datasets stored within Apphub Timestore.

inline.description: Indicates whether queue processing runs inline instead of Redis-backed.

ready.description: True when the lifecycle queue connection is available.

status.description: High-level health indicator for the service.

get.description: Returns the generated OpenAPI document for the timestore service.
Reports lifecycle queue status for the timestore service.

200.description: The service is available for traffic.

503.description: Streaming is enabled but not ready.

get.description: Performs dependency checks to ensure the service can accept requests.

503.description: One or more dependencies are unavailable.

post.description: Schedules ingestion for a dataset partition. Depending on configuration the job may run inline or be enqueued.

parameters.name: datasetSlug
parameters.description: Human-readable slug uniquely identifying a dataset.

202.description: Ingestion job enqueued for asynchronous processing.

403.description: Caller lacks permission to ingest into this dataset.

post.description: Executes a query over the requested dataset using partition pruning and optional downsampling.

parameters.name: datasetSlug
parameters.description: Human-readable slug uniquely identifying a dataset.

403.description: Caller lacks permission to query this dataset.

get.description: Returns the current logical schema exposed to the SQL runtime.

200.description: SQL schema snapshot for available datasets.

403.description: Caller lacks permission to inspect SQL metadata.

500.description: Failed to load SQL schema information.

post.description: Runs a read-only SELECT statement against the SQL runtime and returns the result set in the requested format.

schema.description: Result set rendered as an ASCII table.

403.description: Caller lacks permission to run SQL queries.

406.description: Requested response format is not supported.

200.description: Saved SQL queries accessible to the caller.

403.description: Caller lacks permission to manage saved SQL queries.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the saved query.

403.description: Caller lacks permission to access saved SQL queries.

500.description: Failed to load saved SQL query.

put.summary: Create or update saved SQL query

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the saved query.

403.description: Caller lacks permission to manage saved SQL queries.

500.description: Failed to persist saved SQL query.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the saved query.

403.description: Caller lacks permission to manage saved SQL queries.

500.description: Failed to delete saved SQL query.

post.description: Executes a SQL statement with optional streaming responses for large result sets.

schema.description: Row stream encoded as plain text.

403.description: Caller lacks permission to execute SQL statements.

406.description: Requested response format is not supported.
